column4: how do i make multiple jpegs get a lower resolution at a time insted of 1 by 1 with gimp (is there a way to do this with imagemagick for example?)
that's the kind of thing imagemagick was made for =).. I don't know the exact syntax but it can def do it
well to convert a pdf to jpegs it would be: "convert -units PixelsPerInch -density 150x150 filename.pdf filename.jpg" so would u no how to modify this command?
I'll take a look at it.. I'm bored out of my skull here anyway =)
i need to go to skool and i need to convert my jpeg notes to that res so i can view on my psp and i gota leave in like 5 min
http://www.imagemagick.org/script/convert.php
find ./ -type f -exec convert -resample 100x100 {} \; might do the trick... but better keep a backup just in case it does something nasty
wat part of ur message is the command?
from find up to and including the \;
nope.. didn't work..  it needs an output filename
find ./ -type f -exec convert -resize x480 {} {}-new.jpg \;     This will resize all images to 480 width and save the new images as the old filename + -new.jpg
I think wine is 32-bit.. no matter how you compile it.. (not that it matters for your question.. )
I don't think you can
not without wiping the partition
captain: should i put that in brainstorm?
captain? .. well.. no, it's not a bug.. it's just the way ntfs and ext3 are
captainm is another person here
you can't convert ntfs to ext3 in place, you can't eat candy all day, you cant fly by flapping your arms.. some things aren't meant to be =)
and not as a bug report, as an idea, like couldnt it be a nice feature request or is it absolutely impossible?
I would say it's impossible.. it might be doable but it isn't worth the time and effort
well if u ask me, its worth it cuz such a feature is good to convert windows users ;) but thats not my situation

well.. let's say this will take 400 man years... that time would be better spent on other things.. making directx games run natively in ubuntu, drivers for all graphics cards, booting in <10 secs.. all that.. or convert ntfs to ext3 in place..
awn or cairo-dock
they are both easy to configure (comes with a small gui-configure-dialog thing)
